title: Drawing, "Triumph of Bacchus and Ariadne", early 19th century
medium: Pen and brown-black ink, brush and wash over graphite on off-white wove paper. Borders ruled in ink.
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown-black ink, at top, center: Trionfo de Baco Ariane; in center: convito vendemia e grano; lower third, center: mostra del vino e grano.
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Brandegee, Boston.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Triumph of Bacchus and Ariadne", early 19th century.
early 19th century. Pen and brown-black ink, brush and wash over graphite on off-white wove paper. Borders ruled in ink.. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3079.
